intro: Microstylis tenebrosa, commonly known as the dark-styled microstylis, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as sedges. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically features dark-colored inflorescences, which are often clustered in dense, spike-like structures. Microstylis tenebrosa thrives in moist, shady environments, such as woodland floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
